properties.title: Mission Landing Zone Add-On: Azure Virtual Desktop

options.text: The Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) add-on reduces the complexity in deploying AVD with SCCA and zero trust compliance. Click on the link below to learn more about the solution.

elements.name: subscription
elements.label: Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the subscription for your Mission Landing Zone Hub network, firewall, and remote access resources.

elements.name: virtualNetwork
elements.label: Virtual network
elements.toolTip: Select the existing Hub virtual network.

elements.name: azureFirewall
elements.label: Azure firewall
elements.toolTip: Select the existing Hub Azure firewall.

options.text: The values selected below will be used as components in your naming convention to name your Azure resource groups and resources. For more information on the naming convention used in this solution, refer to the documentation.

elements.name: identifier
elements.label: Identifier
elements.toolTip: Input a 3 character identifier for the resource group and resource names created with this solution. The identifier should represent a unique value within your organization, such as a business unit or project.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be 1 - 3 characters in length, alphanumeric, and lowercase.

elements.name: environment
elements.label: Environment Abbreviation
elements.toolTip: Select the target environment for the solution. The single letter environment abbreviation will be used as part of the naming convention for the resoure groups and resources.

elements.name: stampIndex
elements.label: Stamp Index
elements.toolTip: The stamp index differentiates multiple AVD stamps within the same business unit or project. For example, '0' could be used for an office workers host pool and '1' could be used for a developers host pool.

elements.name: profile
elements.label: Profile
elements.toolTip: Select the type of image to deploy on the session hosts.

allowedValues.label: Generic
allowedValues.description: Common deployment scenario for office workers, developers, and administrators.

request.path: [concat('subscriptions/', first(skip(split(first(map(filter(first(map(filter(steps('basics').hub.virtualNetworksApi.value, (item) => equals(item.id, steps('basics').hub.virtualNetwork)), (item) => item.properties.virtualNetworkPeerings)), (item) => contains(item.properties.remoteVirtualNetwork.id, 'operations')), (item) => item.properties.remoteVirtualNetwork.id)), '/'), 2)), '/resourcegroups/', first(skip(split(first(map(filter(first(map(filter(steps('basics').hub.virtualNetworksApi.value, (item) => equals(item.id, steps('basics').hub.virtualNetwork)), (item) => item.properties.virtualNetworkPeerings)), (item) => contains(item.properties.remoteVirtualNetwork.id, 'operations')), (item) => item.properties.remoteVirtualNetwork.id)), '/'), 4)), '/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces?api-version=2023-09-01')]

elements.name: location
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Select the location for the AVD management resources: host pool, workspace, application group, etc.

constraints.allowedValues: [map(filter(steps('controlPlane').controlPlane.locationsApi.value, (item) => contains(first(map(filter(steps('controlPlane').controlPlane.providerApi.value, (item) => equals(item.resourceType, 'hostpools')), (item) => item.locations)), item.displayName)), (item) => parse(concat('{"label":"', item.displayName, '","value":"', item.name, '"}')))]

elements.name: validation
elements.label: Validation environment
elements.toolTip: Choose whether to deploy the host pool as a validation environment. This allows you test preview features for AVD before they are released to production.

elements.name: workloadType
elements.label: Workload Type
elements.defaultValue: [if(equals(steps('basics').scenario.profile, 'arcGisPro'), 'Power (1 user per core)', 'Heavy (2 users per core)')]
elements.toolTip: Select the type of image to deploy on the session hosts.

allowedValues.label: Power (1 user per core)
allowedValues.description: Graphic designers, 3D model makers, and machine learning researchers

elements.name: customRdpProperties
elements.label: Custom RDP properties
elements.defaultValue: [if(equals(steps('basics').scenario.profile, 'arcGisPro'), 'use multimon:i:1;drivestoredirect:s:;encode redirected video capture:i:1;redirected video capture encoding quality:i:2;audiomode:i:0;devicestoredirect:s:;redirectclipboard:i:0;redirectcomports:i:0;redirectlocation:i:1;redirectprinters:i:0;redirectsmartcards:i:1;redirectwebauthn:i:1;usbdevicestoredirect:s:;keyboardhook:i:2;', 'audiocapturemode:i:1;camerastoredirect:s:*;use multimon:i:0;drivestoredirect:s:;encode redirected video capture:i:1;redirected video capture encoding quality:i:1;audiomode:i:0;devicestoredirect:s:;redirectclipboard:i:0;redirectcomports:i:0;redirectlocation:i:1;redirectprinters:i:0;redirectsmartcards:i:1;redirectwebauthn:i:1;usbdevicestoredirect:s:;keyboardhook:i:2;')]
elements.toolTip: Specify the configuration for the RDP properties on the AVD host pool.

elements.name: publicNetworkAccess
elements.label: Public network access
elements.toolTip: Enabled: allows the host pool to be accessed from both public and private networks. Disabled: allows the host pool to only be accessed via private endpoints.

elements.name: publicNetworkAccess
elements.label: Public network access (feed)
elements.toolTip: Enabled: allows the host pool to be accessed from both public and private networks. Disabled: allows the host pool to only be accessed via private endpoints.

options.text: To access Azure Virtual Desktop, your end users will need to be assigned to the Desktop Applicaiton Group and if applicable, be given permissions on the storage service for FSLogix. Select the desired security groups below to give access to this AVD stamp. If deploying FSLogix, storage will be deployed for each group to support sharding. Be sure your groups are sized appropriately for each shard.

link.label: Learn more about FSLogix storage options for sizing your groups.

elements.name: groupsDropDown
elements.label: Groups
elements.toolTip: Select the desired group(s) to give access to this AVD stamp and if applicable, the FSLogix file share.

elements.name: groupsGrid
elements.ariaLabel: Input the security groups for access to AVD and if applicable, FSLogix. The object ID is a property on the group and can be found in Entra ID.
elements.label: Security Groups

elements.name: custom
elements.label: Custom friendly names?
elements.toolTip: Choose whether to add custom names to the AVD feed workspace and the desktop for the AVD client.

elements.name: workspace
elements.label: Feed Workspace
elements.toolTip: Input the friendly name for the AVD workspace that will be displayed in the end user's client. This value should apply to all the stamp indexes within the same identifier and would mostly likely represent your business unit or project.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be between 1 and 64 characters in length.

elements.name: desktop
elements.label: Desktop
elements.toolTip: Input the friendly name for the AVD Session Desktop application that will be displayed in the end user's client. This value should represent the workload (eg., Help Desk, Development, or Administration) that will be supported on the host pool.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be between 1 and 64 characters in length.

elements.name: source
elements.label: Image Source
elements.toolTip: Select the type of image to deploy on the session hosts.

elements.name: offer
elements.label: Offer
elements.toolTip: Select the desired marketplace image offer.

elements.name: sku
elements.label: SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the desired marketplace image SKU.

elements.name: version
elements.label: Version
elements.toolTip: Select the desired gallery image version.

elements.name: availability
elements.label: Availability Options
elements.toolTip: Select the redundancy / resiliency for the virtual machines.

elements.name: count
elements.label: Count
elements.toolTip: Select the number of virtual machines to deploy in your AVD host pool.

elements.name: diskSku
elements.label: OS Disk SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the disk SKU for the operating system disk.

elements.name: sizeGeneric
elements.label: Size
elements.toolTip: Select the size of the virtual machines. Multi-session hosts should have 4 - 24 vCPUs. Single session host should have 2 or more vCPUs.

elements.name: sizeArcGisPro
elements.label: Size
elements.toolTip: Select the size of the virtual machines. Multi-session hosts should have 4 - 24 vCPUs. Single session host should have 2 or more vCPUs.

elements.name: solution
elements.label: Active Directory Solution
elements.toolTip: Choose the Active Directory solution that already exists.

elements.name: intune
elements.label: Intune Enrollment
elements.toolTip: If Intune is configured in your Azure AD tenant, you can choose to have the VM automatically enrolled during the deployment by selecting Yes.

elements.name: domainName
elements.label: Domain Name
elements.toolTip: Provide domain name for the selected Active Directory solution.

elements.name: ouPath
elements.label: OU Path
elements.toolTip: Input the distinguished name of the desired organization unit for the AVD session hosts.

elements.name: userPrincipalName
elements.label: User Principal Name
elements.toolTip: Enter the user principal name with domain join privileges.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be a valid user principal name.

elements.name: password
elements.toolTip: Enter a password that is alphanumeric, contains at least 12 characters, 1 letter, 1 number and 1 special character.

elements.name: username
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Input the username for the local administrator account.

elements.name: password
elements.toolTip: Input the password for the local administrator account.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be within 12 to 123 characters, be alphanumeric, and include 1 lower case character, 1 upper case character, 1 number, and 1 special character that is not '\' or '-'.

elements.name: profileSolution
elements.label: Profile Solution
elements.toolTip: Select the user profile solution for your end users.

elements.name: service
elements.label: Service
elements.toolTip: Select the Azure storage service for the user profiles.

elements.name: sku
elements.label: SKU
elements.defaultValue: [if(equals(steps('userProfiles').profileSolution, 'local'), concat('Standard ', if(equals(steps('userProfiles').storage.service, 'AzureFiles'), '(20K IOPS)', '(100K IOPS)')), concat('Premium ', if(equals(steps('userProfiles').storage.service, 'AzureFiles'), '(100K IOPS)', '(450K IOPS)')))]
elements.toolTip: Select the storage SKU for the SMB file shares to support the use of FSLogix.

elements.name: fileShareSize
elements.label: File share size (GB)
elements.toolTip: Input the quota size for the SMB file share to support the use of FSLogix.

elements.name: fslogixContainerType
elements.label: FSLogix solution
elements.toolTip: Select the solution for the FSLogix profiles.

elements.name: objectId
elements.label: AVD Object ID
elements.toolTip: Input the object ID for the Azure Virtual Desktop enterprise application in Entra ID. The application ID for the principal is 9cdead84-a844-4324-93f2-b2e6bb768d07.

validations.message: The value must be a globally unique ID.

elements.name: enable
elements.label: Enable drain mode?
elements.toolTip: Enables drain mode on the AVD session hosts so the virtual machines cannot be accessed until they have been validated.

elements.name: enable
elements.label: Enable scaling tool?
elements.toolTip: Choose whether to deploy the required resources to enable the Scaling Tool.

elements.name: beginPeakTime
elements.label: Begin Peak Time
elements.toolTip: Input the time when peak hours begin for your end users.

validations.message: The value must be in a proper time format with a two digit hour and two digit minutes, e.g. 12am should be input as 00:00.

elements.name: endPeakTime
elements.label: End Peak Time
elements.toolTip: Input the time when peak hours end for your end users.

validations.message: The value must be in a proper time format with a two digit hour and two digit minutes, e.g. 8pm should be input as 20:00.

elements.name: forceLogOff
elements.label: Force Log Off (Seconds)
elements.toolTip: Use this setting to force logoff users if session time limit settings cannot be used.

validations.message: The value must be between 1 and 3 digits.

elements.name: minimumHosts
elements.label: Minimum Number of Session Hosts
elements.toolTip: Use this setting to determine the minimum number of sessions hosts to keep online.

validations.message: The value must be between 1 and 4 digits.

elements.name: cpuThreshold
elements.label: Session Threshold Per CPU
elements.toolTip: Use this setting to determine the number of sessions per CPU before turning on another host.

validations.message: The value must be a number with 1 whole number and, if desired, a single or two digit decimal number.

elements.name: recoveryServices
elements.label: Enable recovery services?
elements.toolTip: Choose to deploy backups for your solution. For a personal host pool, this will enable backups on the virtual machines. For a pooled host pool, this will enable backups on the FSLogix file share when using Azure Files.

elements.name: enable
elements.label: Enable monitoring for AVD Insights?
elements.toolTip: Deploy the required resources to enable AVD Insights.

elements.name: agent
elements.label: Monitoring agent
elements.toolTip: Select the solution for the FSLogix profiles.

options.text: Select the storage account and container that hosts the artifacts required to deploy this solution.

elements.name: container
elements.label: Existing container
elements.toolTip: Select the existing container containing the required artifacts.

options.text: Input the file names for the required artifacts from the specified Azure Blobs container above.

elements.name: avdAgentMsiName
elements.label: Azure Virtual Desktop Agent (.msi)
elements.toolTip: Input the file / blob name for the AVD Agent installer.

validations.message: The file name must end with '.msi'.

elements.name: avdAgentBootLoaderMsiName
elements.label: Azure Virtual Desktop Boot Loader (.msi)
elements.toolTip: Input the file / blob name for the AVD Boot Loader installer.

validations.message: The file name must end with '.msi'.

elements.name: azurePowerShellModuleMsiName
elements.label: Azure PowerShell Module Installer (.msi)
elements.toolTip: Input the file / blob name for the Azure PowerShell Module installer.

validations.message: The file name must end with '.msi'.

elements.name: deployDefender
elements.label: Enable Defender for Cloud?
elements.toolTip: Check here to to deploy defender for cloud to the target subscription.

elements.name: emailSecurityContact
elements.label: Email Address for Security Notifications
elements.toolTip: Please enter a valid email address for the security team.

constraints.validationMessage: Email is not valid. Please re-enter.

options.text: Mission Landing Zone comes bundled with a relevant subset of available Azure policies.
Enabling policies is optional, but recommended.

elements.name: deployPolicy
elements.label: Deploy policy assignments?
elements.toolTip: Check here to create policy assignments for the resources created by Mission Landing Zone.

elements.name: policy
elements.label: Policy Assignment
elements.toolTip: DoD IL5 is only available in AzureUsGovernment and will switch to NISTRev4 if tried in AzureCloud.
elements.defaultDescription: Select one of the bundled built-in policy assignments.

allowedValues.label: NIST SP 800-53 Rev4
allowedValues.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a catalog of security and privacy controls, Special Publication (SP) 800-53, for all federal information systems in the United States (except those related to national security).

allowedValues.label: NIST SP 800-53 Rev5
allowedValues.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a catalog of security and privacy controls, Special Publication (SP) 800-53, for all federal information systems in the United States (except those related to national security).

allowedValues.label: DoD IL5
allowedValues.description: The Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) is an agency of the US Department of Defense (DoD) that is responsible for developing and maintaining the DoD Cloud Computing Security Requirements Guide (SRG). These policies are only available for AzureUsGovernment and will switch to NISTRev4 if tried in AzureCloud.

allowedValues.label: CMMC
allowedValues.description: The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) is a new framework developed by the US Department of Defense (DoD) that requires formal third-party audits of defense industrial base (DIB) contractor cybersecurity practices.

elements.name: logAnalyticsWorkspace
elements.label: Existing Log Analytics Workspace for Central Logging
elements.toolTip: Select the existing Hub Azure firewall.
